nextgen.core.annotation
Class AnnotationList<T extends Annotation>

java.lang.Object
  nextgen.core.annotation.AbstractAnnotationCollection<T>
      nextgen.core.annotation.AnnotationList<T>
Type Parameters:
T -
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<T>, AnnotationCollection<T>
public class AnnotationList<T extends Annotation>
extends AbstractAnnotationCollection<T>
implements java.lang.Iterable<T>

Author:
engreitz Class for storing and oeprating on a set of annotations in memory Allows multiple identical annotations. Iterators, counting, etc. always consider the filters present in the AnnotationList. TODO: Add a different class that will dynamically read BED files, perhaps by using an indexing system TODO: Add a global extension factor TODO: Integrate with modified reader classes that can populate an AnnotationList from a file (this class should not be responsible for parsing or reading - only for storing and manipulating) TODO: Alternative (faster?) implementation: remove all annotations that don't pass filters so you don't have to test every annotation every time you iterate. In this implementation, addFilter would apply the filter to all annotations upon addition, removing those that do not pass.

getPermutedAnnotations

public net.sf.samtools.util.CloseableIterator<T> getPermutedAnnotations(Annotation region)
Description copied from interface: AnnotationCollection
Shuffle the locations of annotations within the given region and return an iterator over the permuted annotations. Permuted annotations will not be necessarily sorted. NOTE: This will alter the annotations in the reader, so re-reading or reloading might be necessary.

Specified by:
getPermutedAnnotations in interface AnnotationCollection<T extends Annotation>
Parameters:
region - reads reads fully contained in this region will be shuffled
